clinical_study.brief_title: Glycemic Responses to Majia Pomelos in Type 2 Diabetic Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: The prevalence of type 2 diabetes (T2DM) is substantially increasing, partially due to the inappropriate diets. It is well documented that adherence to a healthy diet can improve glycemic control and may reduce glycosylated hemoglobin (HbA1c) levels. Pomelo is one of the most widely cultivated and consumed fruits in China. However, substantial scientific data on their nutritional compositions of pomelo are not available. The investigators purpose in this study is to identify the nutritional value of one type of pomelo named Majia pomelo and obtain the information about whether this variety of pomelo is appropriate for diabetic patients.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Supportive Care

Exclusion Criteria:
- For both healthy and diabetic volunteers included morbid obesity (BMI > 40 kg/m2), pre diabetes, pregnancy, presence of gastroenterological disorders, alimentary tract surgery, a history of gastroenteritis in the prior six months, any alcohol intake, smoking, taking any medications (except metformin), poorly controlled diabetes (HbA1c > 8%) and the presence of chronic diseases (such as bronchial asthma or rheumatoid arthritis) or acute illness (such as upper respiratory tract or urinary tract infection)
